info.game_comments:
2009 Tournament of Champions quarterfinal game 3.
From Las Vegas.

(1, 1).clue: Around 1668 Isaac Newton built the first reflecting one of these

(2, 1).clue: A plane crashes,people die (though it doesn't slow some of 'em down much),much DHARMA but little Greg

(3, 1).clue: Twain said of this dance, "I placed my hands before my face for very shame, but I looked through my fingers"

(4, 1).clue: Movie theater chain AMC is "American" this "Cinema"--a prefix often found in front of "plex"

(5, 1).clue: You might score with this speech's first line, but the second begins, "Now we are engaged in a great Civil War"

(6, 1).clue: The scowl of a circus buffoon

(1, 2).clue: Newton made some of his greatest discoveries while Cambridge University was closed because of this in 1665

(2, 2).clue: Gary Coleman co-stars,at home with the Drummonds,what'chu talkin' 'bout, contestants?

(3, 2).clue: We don't know if she was statuesque, but Rose Beuret was the longtime love of this sculptor

(4, 2).clue: H&R Block was named for founding brothers Henry & him

(5, 2).clue: "These united colonies... are absolved from all allegiance to the British crown" is a statement from this

(6, 2).clue: The mark of Zorro, when he doesn't charge you for it

(1, 3).clue: In 1676 Newton opined, "If I have seen further, it is by standing on the shoulders of" these

(2, 3).clue: Love was all around the newsroom,Chuckles bit the dust,Lou, Lou, Louuuuuuu...

(3, 3).clue: He designed a towering Gallery of Machines for the Paris Exposition of 1867

(5, 3).clue: "Promote the general welfare, and secure the blessings of liberty" are 10 of the 52 words of this

(6, 3).clue: An African equine born under the sign of the scales

(1, 4).clue: Force equals mass times acceleration is the second of these Newtonian formulations

(2, 4).clue: Lonely astronaut hits the bottle,2,000-year-old woman pops out of it,wackiness ensues

(4, 4).clue: The 3 Ms in the original name of 3M

(1, 5).clue: This British queen knighted Newton in 1705

(2, 5).clue: Alaskan adventures,Cicely but not Tyson,ah, the casual moose-about-town

(4, 5).clue: The "C" in the name of department store founder J.C. Penney; how appropriate

(1, 1).clue: The surgeon begins by making an incision above the hairline in this cosmetic procedure aka rhytidoplasty

(6, 1).clue: Calling HAZMAT!  It's the act of making something impure or polluted

(1, 2).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew shows an anatomical diagram on the monitor.)  Named for a 19th-century surgeon, McBurney's point, 2/3rds the distance between the umbilicus & the iliac crest of the pelvis, is the most tender abdominal area when this organ is inflamed & often requires surgery

(2, 2).clue: Duracells weren't given with this Cronyn-Tandy epic about tiny spaceships:"*b____ n____ i____"

(3, 2).clue: For a short time in the 1950s, La Plata, Argentina was named for her

(4, 2).clue: The stages of grief: denial, anger, bargaining, this--also an economic term

(5, 2).correct response: Sir Gawain and the Green Knight

(6, 2).clue: This word means to put off until another day or time

(1, 3).clue: Hip replacement entails removing the arthritic head of this bone & preparing a new socket in the pelvic bone
